comment: Professor Taylor is the best lecturer I have ever had. OpenStax is the free online textbook, which is very useful. The material in this course is simple and straightforward. Grades are made up of participation and 4 exams (one is dropped). Review the textbook questions and lectures to prepare for the LockDown Webcam exam. Overall great professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: He is a great lecturer and gives the best feedback on assignments. Attendance is graded but you do get 3 unexcused freebies. Every week had the same assignment schedule so his course is super easy to prepare for and he's also super organized!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: GREAT, AMAZING, AND VERY FUNNY PROFESSOR. very neutral teaching. If anything he says offends you, then you're offended by facts. I took the honors course, had 4 exams. 25 mulitple choice 10 t/f and 10 short answer, and one long paragraph question. His course is very interesting and got me into political science. TAKE HIM unless you hate your life.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Hilarious

comment: He was a GREAT American Govt teacher for me. He wasn't biased about anything, and gave his lectures in a fun way! He only grades you on attendance and the 4 Exams. He will give you 2 days to miss (and if not, they are extra credit points) The exams are literally the questions from the book and vocab. He also gives easy extra credit assignments
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: This professor is absolutely phenomenal. His goal is to help everyone succeed academically as well as providing everyone with the resources to make smart decisions when it comes to politics. He is super easy to reach outside of class and is always willing to accommodate students to help them succeed. Wonderful professor!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Hilarious--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor is amazing. Your grade is made up of 4 exam grades and class participation. You are only required to show up to class and READ THE TEXTBOOK. If you read the textbook and know all the answers to the review questions in the book, you will be successful. tests are easy and are in person.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Professor Taylor is awesome. He truly cares about you learning the material, but also that you are successful in his class. There are only 4 exams and Attendance counts toward your grade, but he gives you plenty of time to prepare. He gives out a study guide before each exam, but my best advice would be to read all the chapters. 100% recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment: Dr. Taylor is a very kind and funny professor who has a very clear passion for political science. I appreciate that while he has clear political views on certain topics, he mostly stays unbiased and just presents the information. In the honors version of this course, we did 2 analytical papers and 2 essays for mid and final with Qs given prior.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Respected--Lecture heavy

comment: It was POLS 2101. Four tests, open book with limited time so still study! Four papers at 3-5 pgs each. Really easy class. Fun discussion posts. Dynamic professor. Lots of extra credit - replaces lowest test grade with highest test grade plus other extra credit. Will take again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Taylor definitely knows his stuff and does a great job at teaching it. He gave us 4 tests over the semester where the lowest score would be dropped and the highest was counted twice. Reviewing the key terms and study questions in the textbook really helps for the exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Taylor laid out clear guidelines for what was needed to succeed in his class. He also gave buffers to ensure each student could make a good great despite mistakes. Just read the textbook, attend lectures, and look at review questions and you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Only graded with four tests (lowest score dropped and highest doubled) and attendance. Two excused absences are available, but if you attend everyday, he counts the two days for extra credit. Mainly studied key terms at end of each chapter and review questions. He copies and pastes questions from textbook. Awesome Professor!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Taylor was an amazing professor. You are only graded on four tests, and that's it. He tends to pull many of his answers on his tests from the book. As long as you do the questions in the book, you'll do great. He is very funny and does not give any homework. You do however, have two extra credit opportunities throughout the semester. DO THEM!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: This class is only hard if you don't do the practice questions in the back of the book. Lectures are very long but he is passionate about what he is talking about. The grade is calculated by attendance (10%) and 4 exams (90%). Attendance is mandatory but you get two excused absences. There is some extra credit available.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He's ok. BUT, If your not good at tests then this professor is not for you because he only grades 4 tests(90%) and attendance(10%). If you don't like reading, Again this professor is not for you. You may question, are the test are in computer with no lockdown. NO, it's on paper. Recammond you to go with a different professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Okay class, just read the textbook and attend the lectures. Takes attendance at the end of classes with Kahoot. 4 exams. He is nice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: I have taken multiple courses with Dr. Taylor. I can honestly say that he has contributed more to my education and understanding of the various concepts explored in Political Science than any other professor. Super smart, great lecturer, wants students to succeed... I cannot say enough good things about this guy.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: W teacher. Attendance was a Kahoot at the end and his test is just his lectures. 4 tests and he replaces final with lowest would 100% recommend.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the best professors I've had at Kennesaw! His lectures are entertaining and he teaches the content in a way that makes it really easy to understand and remember. The exams were the only grades besides participation (10%), which I liked because there was no homework.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Respected--Graded by few things

comment: I really liked both of his classes I've taken, and I learned a lot from both of them.  There is a decent bit of reading and writing, so be prepared for that.  He gives good lectures and notes.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: If you can study, the class is easy enough. Lectures are interesting. Attendance is mandatory (10% of the grade), but you get 4 excused absences. READ THE TEXTBOOK. He only gives 4 major tests which is 90% of your grade, but he replaces your lowest test grade with your highest test grade.
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: Funny guy and enthusiastic lecturer. Course is graded from attendance and four tests. Your lowest test score is replaced with your highest, (meaning your highest score gets counted twice) so you can skip one exam with no consequence. There's also four auto-excused absences, so you can easily keep an 100 without having perfect attendance.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This is an easy class if youre willing to take the time to go over the practice questions in the back of the online textbook chapters. there are only 4 grades (exams) but i did well on all of them by going through the textbook questions. Dr Taylor is a funny and knowledgeable guy so going to class isnt a bore, definitely take again.

4 tests (50 questions each), lowest test grade dropped, and 5% of overall grade is on attendance through kahoot at the end of class. Tests are straight from the free online textbook (questions and definitions) so studying isnt too bad and he adds points whenever questions are worded weird. Easy A if you study the chapter summaries for each test :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Very cool guy, there is a lot of reading and writing each week but hes pretty lenient when it comes to grading. Each week you will have to read to articles for discussion posts and work on a research paper throughout the entire semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Taylor makes the content interesting and presents it well. He is a fair grader and gives great feedback. He is very encouraging when you ask questions and will follow up to make sure your question as answered. Really great teacher!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Wonderful, caring, and respectable. Weird scheduling issue with COVID this semester, but he provided the class with online options like a champ. He's understanding to personal issues and strives to see students succeed. He teaches with passion and respects diverse opinions. Pretty easy quizzes with textbook and do take final papers seriously.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Taylor was amazing! He offered great feedback & really wants everyone to pass! We were able to attend class via zoom at first then ksu made him stop doing that. After that attendance was extra credit. We had quizzes every 2 weeks and the paper was spaced out. 100% would take him again, he made this class feel less intimidating and a lot easier!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: honestly one of the best poli sci professors. clearly cares about what he teaches and makes it super interesting. very understanding if stuff comes up (being sick/mental health, etc) i adore this man. 10/10 would die for him. also he likes the show "new girl". what a green flag
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Taylor was a great professor. I took POLS 2212 through Fall 2020 during the covid-19 pandemic and he was accommodating to requests to stay home and work remotely without attending in person lectures. The lecture series' he uploads every unit are very helpful, and as long as you take notes and read the textbook, its an easy class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Great class! I enjoyed the lectures and the textbook was easy to read. Prof. Taylor is really nice and responds quickly to questions. I would definitely take another class with this Professor and I recommend taking this class specifically, easy A if you keep up and turn everything in on time!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Taylor is a great professor and everyone should take him. He is very knowledgeable in his subject and really cares for his students. There are a lot of papers but if you follow the rubric youll be fine.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: This class was very enjoyable. I took this course for the summer semester and each week there were 2 quizzes, discussion boards, and comparative analysis. The quizzes were not on lockdown. You get to choose 4 topics from the 8 comparative analysis to complete. Extremely easy!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a very good professor all the assignments are clear you pick 4 of 8 essays to do for the entire semester they don't have to be long and are typically interesting there is a discussion for each module but its no word count and as long as it has some substance and you reply you should get a 100. You would have to put in zero effort to fail this
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: A very funny guy with a great personality! Lectures can get a bit long but he always made us laugh. Seriously, just read the textbook and pay attention most of the time. He sends out helpful reviews before the tests. No essays, no quizzes, says attendance is mandatory but somehow I got a 100 with less than perfect attendance. Would take again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Taylor is clearly very passionate about American Government. Attendance made up 20% and the four tests we took made up the other 80%. Everything on the tests were in the free online textbook and he told us what wed have to study for free response. I believe hes the best choice for POLS 1101 for an A compared to what Ive heard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Taylor is enthusiastic about what he teaches & makes what could easily be a boring class interesting even for those who have no interest in politics. Grading is made up of 4 tests & attendance. The textbook is free and chapter questions are in the test. Lockdown browser is required. He is accesible outside of class & provides reviews.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: You have to post two discussion posts and respond to two people for each module, write 4 essays over the semester, and there are 8 tests. The discussions and essays were fine but the tests were not. I was getting the same grade on the tests whether I read the entire chapters covered or not.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: This professor made Political science so easy for me, he is a great guy. Attend class if youre hoping for an A. The only people who dont do well in this class are the ones that probably shouldnt be attending college in general.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Literally I have never had a professor who grades so hard. You will spend hours working on a paper for this class and no matter how good you think it is, he will still give you an F or maybe a barely passing grade on a good day. Do not take him!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This man was so funny, I never even realized how much I learned until test days. He's also VERY understanding of how lazy college kids are and curves/grades/drops things appropriately. While it's almost required that you purchase the textbook and do the assigned readings, you can scrape by with lecture material--but don't expect an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Absolutely LOVED this class! I have never been good at any type of political science and I passed this class with flying colors! Came into class early just to chat with the professor because he was just so kind and caring. I have never had a professor so lovely! Easy weekly quizzes online, extra credit on every test, attendance taken each class.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He curved our 3 exams so doing well in this class is very easy. You have weekly quizzes online on the textbook chapters but can use quizlet for them, they are like 30% of your grade. He takes attendance with Kahoot (10% of grade) but forgets it rather often. He is funny which makes his lectures interesting. He will put his Powerpoints online.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Very good professor with detailed lectures that aren't boring, with powerpoints that he posts online. If you show up to class and take notes, theres no way you could fail. Easy Kahoot quizzes for an attendance grade and study guides are just like the tests. There are 3 written exams and weekly quizzes online, and also has extra credit opportunities
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: open note quizzes every week; tests are open response, but questions come directly from the study guide
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY
